question: 殖える
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>multiply</kanji> and the verb vocab version means <vocabulary>to multiply</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to increase</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: What is multiplying? Your use of the word "<reading>fu</reading>" (<ja>ふ</ja>) for when you laugh. You used to say just "ha ha ha" like everyone else. Now the occurrences of you saying <reading>fufufu</reading> is really multiplying. You might also notice that this is similar to the word <ja>増える</ja>, which means "to increase." This has a similar meaning and the same reading, use that to your advantage!
